timeline.bodyText:
Being a good example :) I'd suggest using the addOnData dir, IMO we should move away from format/type dir names.
The corresponding passive scan rule should have the same changes for consistency.
timeline.author: thc202

timeline.message:
ascanrulesAlpha/pscanrulesAlpha: Minor tweaks to example scan rules

* zapHomeFiles/xml -> zapHomeFiles/txt - Putting everything in xml is
something we used to do. I 'think' this can be in an appropriately named
directory (similar to the HFF json file/folder).
* ExampleFileActiveScanner - Updated with adjusted path.
* ExampleFilePassiveSanner - Updated with adjusted path.
* JSFunctionPassiveScanner - Updated with adjusted path.
* CHANGELOG - Added change note (maint).

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>
